abstracts.cdata!:
The project forms part of the 1978-82
            national power expansion program and it includes: (a)
            consisting of two surface powerhouses, each with three
            generating units totaling 600 MW, and tunnels and penstocks,
            as well as a pumping station for an existing head pond, and
            three 230 kV transmission lines; (b) strengthening of the
            Sesquile dam against possible future earthquake damage; (c)
            an asset valuation study; and (d) technical assistance to
            EEEB on financial planning and staff training. The project
            is an unusually low-cost power development, as large dams
            are unnecessary. The Mesitas facility would meet about 95%
            of projected incremental energy demand in the EEEB system
            during 1982-84, including that attributable to 70,000 new
            subscribers to be connected annual over this period.
            Improvement of EEEB's structure of tariffs and rates
            would be a major institutional focus of the proposed loan.
            The project is subject to the risks normally associated with
            underground civil works under difficult geological
            conditions. However, the actions that have been taken to
            minimize risk should ensure that the project will be carried
            out as scheduled.
